author: Staff Reporter
text:
Representatives of Puthu Nagar Residents Welfare Association petitioned Collector S. Jayandhi on Monday with a plea to give directions to PWD for issuance of structural stability certificate to the 156 apartments in the colony.

“The apartments, which are constructed in 13 blocks by Tamil Nadu Housing Board in 1985 over an area of 1.78 acre near Tirupur railway station and now owned by individuals, have crossed its normal life span of around 25 to 30 years.

Now, majority of the flats are in a dilapidated condition with either concrete ceiling peeled off or cracks developed in the main structures itself. With lots of residents raised apprehension about their safety, we wanted the PWD to evaluate the stability of the building”, R. Ganesh, president of the Residents Welfare Association, told reporters.

The residents pointed out that majority of the dwellers wanted to destroy the present apartments and construct new ones and hence, decided to obtain the certificate as a school, residences and commercial establishments are located close to the colony.
title: ‘Instruct PWD to issue structural stability certificate’
